definition: to arrange/to line up/file/series/(in data tables) column/(Tw) row

sentences.english: He was still a private due to some unexpected accidents.
sentences.chinese: 由于一些意外时间的发生，他仍然是一个列兵。

sentences.english: An Enlisted Soldier's rank can range from Private to Sergeant Major of the Army.
sentences.chinese: 一名募征兵的军衔从列兵至总军士长。

sentences.english: He went looking for Sterner to give him the good news.
sentences.chinese: 他去找斯特恩列兵，告诉他这个好消息。

sentences.english: Lieutenants, even corporals and privates, are trained to be entrepreneurial in combat.
sentences.chinese: 尉官，甚至士官和列兵都受到训练做一个战斗企业家。

sentences.english: May I ask, to privates, you have what show?
sentences.chinese: 请问，去列兵的话，你都有什么表演？

sentences.english: For being absent without leave, the corporal was demoted to private.
sentences.chinese: 这位下士因未经许可擅自缺席而被降为列兵。

sentences.english: Private perconte, have you been blousing your trousers over your boots like a paratrooper?
sentences.chinese: 列兵派康提，你是学伞兵吧裤子塞进靴子里了？

definition: lowest-ranked noncommissioned officer (e.g. corporal in the army or petty officer, third class in the navy)
warrant officer/petty officer/noncommissioned officer (NCO)/Japanese military officer
junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
